title.en: Biographies of Yuan Ang and Chao Cuo
title.raw: 《袁盎鼂錯列傳》 Biographies of Yuan Ang and Chao Cuo

sentences.zh: 袁盎者，楚人也，字絲。

translations.literal: Yuan Ang, Chu person, courtesy name Si.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Ang was a man from Chu, with the courtesy name Si.

sentences.zh: 父故為群盜，徙處安陵。

translations.literal: Father formerly group bandit, moved dwell Anling.
translations.idiomatic: His father had formerly been a bandit leader, and they moved to live in Anling.

sentences.zh: 高后時，盎嘗為呂祿舍人。

translations.literal: High Empress time, Ang once serve Lü Lu as retainer.
translations.idiomatic: During the time of Empress Gao, Ang once served as a retainer in Lü Lu's household.

sentences.zh: 及孝文帝即位，盎兄噲任盎為中郎。

translations.literal: Reach Filial Wen Emperor ascend throne, Ang brother Kui appoint Ang as palace attendant.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen ascended the throne, Ang's brother Kui recommended Ang to serve as a palace attendant.

sentences.zh: 絳侯為丞相，朝罷趨出，意得甚。

translations.literal: Ang appearance short small, temperament straightforward harsh.
translations.idiomatic: Ang was short in stature and had a straightforward, harsh temperament.

sentences.zh: 上禮之恭，常自送之。

translations.literal: Wen Emperor initially ascend, many affairs pending.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen first ascended the throne, many matters were pending.

sentences.zh: 袁盎進曰：「陛下以丞相何如人？」

translations.literal: Ang brother Kui, Emperor Wen old friend, Kui often praise Ang able.
translations.idiomatic: Ang's brother Kui was an old friend of Emperor Wen, and Kui often praised Ang's abilities.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「社稷臣。」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen appoint Ang as counselor.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen appointed Ang as a counselor.

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「絳侯所謂功臣，非社稷臣，社稷臣主在與在，主亡與亡。

translations.literal: Ang enter palace, see Emperor Wen, Emperor Wen say: "Your brother Kui, my old friend, often praise you."
translations.idiomatic: When Ang entered the palace and saw Emperor Wen, the emperor said: "Your brother Kui is my old friend, and he often praises you."

sentences.zh: 方呂后時，諸呂用事，擅相王，劉氏不絕如帶。

translations.literal: Ang bow thank, rise say: "Emperor rise from commoner become Son of Heaven, Ang also rise from commoner become counselor, emperor brother also commoner, this ancient rare matter."
translations.idiomatic: Ang bowed and thanked him, then stood up and said: "Your Majesty rose from commoner status to become Son of Heaven, and I rose from commoner status to become a counselor. Even the emperor's own brothers remain commoners—this is something rarely seen in ancient times."

sentences.zh: 是時絳侯為太尉，主兵柄，弗能正。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen laugh, favor Ang.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen laughed and took a liking to Ang.

sentences.zh: 呂后崩，大臣相與共畔諸呂，太尉主兵，適會其成功，所謂功臣，非社稷臣。

translations.literal: Ang often straight speak advise, Emperor Wen often adopt.
translations.idiomatic: Ang often spoke bluntly in his advice, and Emperor Wen frequently adopted his suggestions.

sentences.zh: 丞相如有驕主色。

translations.literal: Ang position counselor, salary two thousand stone.
translations.idiomatic: Ang held the position of counselor with a salary of two thousand shi of grain.

sentences.zh: 陛下謙讓，臣主失禮，竊為陛下不取也。」

translations.literal: Ang often straight speak, not curry favor.
translations.idiomatic: Ang often spoke frankly and did not curry favor.

sentences.zh: 後朝，上益莊，丞相益畏。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen once discuss with Ang, say: "Human nature what like?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen once discussed with Ang, saying: "What is human nature like?"

sentences.zh: 已而絳侯望袁盎曰：「吾與而兄善，今兒廷毀我！」

translations.literal: Ang say: "Human nature like kneaded dough, make it round make round, make it square make square."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "Human nature is like kneaded dough—make it round and it becomes round, make it square and it becomes square."

sentences.zh: 盎遂不謝。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen nod head.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen nodded his head.

sentences.zh: 及絳侯免相之國，國人上書告以為反，徵系清室，宗室諸公莫敢為言，唯袁盎明絳侯無罪。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Only Yao Shun nature, cannot change."
translations.idiomatic: Ang added: "Only Yao and Shun had natures that could not be changed."

sentences.zh: 絳侯得釋，盎頗有力。

translations.literal: Ang once say: "I hear kill person pay life, wound person pay wound, this ancient law."
translations.idiomatic: Ang once said: "I have heard that killing someone requires paying with one's life, wounding someone requires paying with a wound—this is the ancient law."

sentences.zh: 絳侯乃大與盎結交。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "If now law not execute, what?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen asked: "If the law is not enforced now, what then?"

sentences.zh: 淮南厲王朝，殺辟陽侯，居處驕甚。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Law so, but execution depend ruler."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "The law is such, but its enforcement depends on the ruler."

sentences.zh: 袁盎諫曰：「諸侯大驕必生患，可適削地。」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "I hear whip person back, blood flow, what?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: "I have heard that whipping someone on the back until blood flows—what about that?"

sentences.zh: 上弗用。

translations.literal: Ang say: "This flogging, ancient called 'reed punishment', not kill person."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "This is flogging; in ancient times it was called 'reed punishment', and it does not kill the person."

sentences.zh: 淮南王益橫。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Now law, kill person pay life, wound person pay wound, this appropriate?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen asked: "According to current law, killing someone requires paying with life, wounding someone requires paying with a wound—is this appropriate?"

sentences.zh: 及棘蒲侯柴武太子謀反事覺，治，連淮南王，淮南王徵，上因遷之蜀，轞車傳送。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Appropriate."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "It is appropriate."

sentences.zh: 袁盎時為中郎將，乃諫曰：「陛下素驕淮南王，弗稍禁，以至此，今又暴摧折之。

translations.literal: Ang once advise Emperor Wen, say: "I hear Zhou Wang build spirit tower, place gold jade dog horse, after hundred years, become dung soil, not know dog horse eat gold jade, this what use?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang once advised Emperor Wen, saying: "I have heard that King Zhou built spirit towers and placed gold, jade, dogs, and horses in them. After a hundred years, they all become dung and soil, and one cannot tell whether dogs and horses ate the gold and jade—what use is this?"

sentences.zh: 淮南王為人剛，如有遇霧露行道死，陛下竟為以天下之大弗能容，有殺弟之名，柰何？」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen laugh.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen laughed.

sentences.zh: 上弗聽，遂行之。

translations.literal: Ang once see Emperor Wen, Emperor Wen bare foot sit on bed.
translations.idiomatic: Ang once saw Emperor Wen sitting barefoot on his bed.

sentences.zh: 淮南王至雍，病死，聞，上輟食，哭甚哀。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule ten thousand chariots, own world, but now bare foot, what poverty so?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules over ten thousand chariots and owns the world, yet now sits barefoot—what poverty is this?"

sentences.zh: 盎入，頓首請罪。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Emperor not have one county, but now own world, not bare foot what?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen replied: "I did not have even one county as emperor, but now I own the world—why should I not sit barefoot?"

sentences.zh: 上曰：「以不用公言至此。」

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule world, should wear shoes."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules the world and should wear shoes."

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「上自寬，此往事，豈可悔哉！

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Emperor bare foot, not because poor, but because ancient custom."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: "I sit barefoot not because I am poor, but because of ancient custom."

sentences.zh: 且陛下有高世之行者三，此不足以毀名。」

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule world, should change ancient custom."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules the world and should change ancient customs."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「吾高世行三者何事？」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen did not listen.

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「陛下居代時，太后嘗病，三年，陛下不交睫，不解衣，湯藥非陛下口所嘗弗進。

translations.literal: Ang once say: "I hear ancient make coffin, thick seven inches, above use varnish, now people make coffin thick eight inches, varnish above, this not ancient ritual."
translations.idiomatic: Ang once said: "I have heard that in ancient times coffins were made seven inches thick with varnish applied above. Now people make coffins eight inches thick with varnish applied above—this is not the ancient ritual."

sentences.zh: 夫曾參以布衣猶難之，今陛下親以王者修之，過曾參孝遠矣。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Not hear this."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: "I have not heard of this."

sentences.zh: 夫諸呂用事，大臣專制，然陛下從代乘六傳馳不測之淵，雖賁育之勇不及陛下。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Now people make coffin, thick eight inches, varnish above, this exceed ancient, but people not stop, because life people many, dead people few, life people compete luxury."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Now people make coffins eight inches thick with varnish above, which exceeds the ancient standard, but people do not stop because there are many living people and few dead ones, so the living compete in luxury."

sentences.zh: 陛下至代邸，西向讓天子位者再，南面讓天子位者三。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen adopt this, issue edict limit coffin thickness.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen adopted this advice and issued an edict limiting coffin thickness.

sentences.zh: 夫許由一讓，而陛下五以天下讓，過許由四矣。

translations.literal: Ang once advise Emperor Wen, say: "I hear Zhou Wang build spirit tower, place gold jade dog horse, after hundred years, become dung soil, not know dog horse eat gold jade, this what use?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang once advised Emperor Wen, saying: "I have heard that King Zhou built spirit towers and placed gold, jade, dogs, and horses in them. After a hundred years, they all become dung and soil, and one cannot tell whether dogs and horses ate the gold and jade—what use is this?"

sentences.zh: 且陛下遷淮南王，欲以苦其志，使改過，有司衛不謹，故病死。」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen laugh.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen laughed.

sentences.zh: 於是上乃解，曰：「將柰何？」

translations.literal: Ang once see Emperor Wen bare foot sit on bed.
translations.idiomatic: Ang once saw Emperor Wen sitting barefoot on his bed.

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「淮南王有三子，唯在陛下耳。」

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule ten thousand chariots, own world, but now bare foot, what poverty so?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules over ten thousand chariots and owns the world, yet now sits barefoot—what poverty is this?"

sentences.zh: 於是文帝立其三子皆為王。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Emperor not have one county, but now own world, not bare foot what?"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen replied: "I did not have even one county as emperor, but now I own the world—why should I not sit barefoot?"

sentences.zh: 盎由此名重朝廷。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule world, should wear shoes."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules the world and should wear shoes."

sentences.zh: 袁盎常引大體慨。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Emperor bare foot, not because poor, but because ancient custom."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: "I sit barefoot not because I am poor, but because of ancient custom."

sentences.zh: 宦者趙同以數幸，常害袁盎，袁盎患之。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor rule world, should change ancient custom."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Your Majesty rules the world and should change ancient customs."

sentences.zh: 盎兄子種為常侍騎，持節夾乘，說盎曰：「君與鬬，廷辱之，使其毀不用。」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen did not listen.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝出，趙同參乘，袁盎伏車前曰：「臣聞天子所與共六尺輿者，皆天下豪英。

translations.literal: Ang once say: "I hear ancient make coffin, thick seven inches, above use varnish, now people make coffin thick eight inches, varnish above, this not ancient ritual."
translations.idiomatic: Ang once said: "I have heard that in ancient times coffins were made seven inches thick with varnish applied above. Now people make coffins eight inches thick with varnish applied above—this is not the ancient ritual."

sentences.zh: 今漢雖乏人，陛下獨奈何與刀鋸餘人載！」

translations.literal: Emperor Wen say: "Not hear this."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: "I have not heard of this."

sentences.zh: 於是上笑，下趙同。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Now people make coffin, thick eight inches, varnish above, this exceed ancient, but people not stop, because life people many, dead people few, life people compete luxury."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Now people make coffins eight inches thick with varnish above, which exceeds the ancient standard, but people do not stop because there are many living people and few dead ones, so the living compete in luxury."

sentences.zh: 趙同泣下車。

translations.literal: Zhao Tong weep descend carriage.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Tong wept and got down from the carriage.

sentences.zh: 文帝從霸陵上，欲西馳下峻阪。

translations.literal: Wen Emperor from Ba Mausoleum above, want west gallop descend steep slope.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen ascended from Ba Mausoleum and wanted to gallop west down the steep slope.

sentences.zh: 袁盎騎，并車擥轡。

translations.literal: Yuan Ang ride horse, together carriage pull rein.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Ang rode on horseback and pulled the reins of the emperor's carriage together.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「將軍怯邪？」

translations.literal: Emperor say: "General cowardly?"
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Is the general cowardly?"

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「臣聞千金之子坐不垂堂，百金之子不騎衡，聖主不乘危而徼幸。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Minister hear thousand gold son sit not hang hall, hundred gold son not ride fence, sage lord not ride danger seek fortune.
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "I have heard that a son worth a thousand pieces of gold does not sit near the edge of a hall, a son worth a hundred pieces does not ride the railing. A sage ruler does not risk danger to seek good fortune.

sentences.zh: 今陛下騁六騑，馳下峻山，如有馬驚車敗，陛下縱自輕，柰高廟、太后何？」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty drive six horses, gallop descend steep mountain, if have horse startled carriage overturn, Your Majesty even self light, how High Temple, Empress Dowager what?"
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty drives six horses and gallops down a steep mountain. If a horse were startled and the carriage overturned, even if Your Majesty were to treat yourself lightly, what of the High Temple and the Empress Dowager?"

sentences.zh: 上乃止。

translations.literal: Emperor then stop.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then stopped.

sentences.zh: 上幸上林，皇后、慎夫人從。

translations.literal: Emperor visit Shanglin, Empress, Shen夫人 from.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor visited Shanglin Park, and the Empress and Lady Shen followed.

sentences.zh: 其在禁中，常同席坐。

translations.literal: Their in forbidden palace, often same mat sit.
translations.idiomatic: When they were in the inner palace, they often sat on the same mat.

sentences.zh: 及坐，郎署長布席，袁盎引卻慎夫人坐。

translations.literal: Reach sit, palace attendant director spread mat, Yuan Ang pull back Shen夫人 sit.
translations.idiomatic: When they sat down, the palace attendant spread the mat, but Yuan Ang pulled Lady Shen back to sit.

sentences.zh: 慎夫人怒，不肯坐。

translations.literal: Shen夫人 anger, not eat several days.
translations.idiomatic: Lady Shen became angry and did not eat for several days.

sentences.zh: 上亦怒，起，入禁中。

translations.literal: Ang say: "I non dare love Empress, but Empress horse, Empress son will be lord.
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "I do not dare to slight the Empress, but the Empress is old, and the Empress's son will become ruler.

sentences.zh: 盎因前說曰：「臣聞尊卑有序則上下和。

translations.literal: Shen夫人 son lord, then Shen夫人 Empress Dowager, Your Majesty son nothing, hundred years after, spirit tablet not enter temple."
translations.idiomatic: If Lady Shen's son becomes ruler, then Lady Shen will become Empress Dowager, and Your Majesty's son will have nothing. A hundred years from now, his spirit tablet will not enter the temple."

sentences.zh: 今陛下既已立后，慎夫人乃妾，妾主豈可與同坐哉！

translations.literal: Emperor say: "What?"
translations.idiomatic: The emperor asked: "What?"

sentences.zh: 適所以失尊卑矣。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Empress son Tai, Shen夫人 son Liang, Tai son Changshan, Liang son Huaiyang.
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "The Empress's son is Tai, Lady Shen's son is Liang, Tai's son is Changshan, Liang's son is Huaiyang.

sentences.zh: 且陛下幸之，即厚賜之。

translations.literal: Changshan king die no son, spirit tablet enter temple; Huaiyang king die no son, spirit tablet enter temple.
translations.idiomatic: When the Changshan king dies without a son, his spirit tablet enters the temple; when the Huaiyang king dies without a son, his spirit tablet enters the temple.

sentences.zh: 陛下所以為慎夫人，適所以禍之。

translations.literal: Emperor son die, enter temple; Empress son die, enter temple.
translations.idiomatic: When the emperor's son dies, he enters the temple; when the empress's son dies, he enters the temple.

sentences.zh: 陛下獨不見『人彘』乎？」

translations.literal: Shen夫人 son die, not enter temple, this I say."
translations.idiomatic: When Lady Shen's son dies, he does not enter the temple—this is what I mean."

sentences.zh: 於是上乃說，召語慎夫人。

translations.literal: Emperor not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor did not listen.

sentences.zh: 慎夫人賜盎金五十斤。

translations.literal: Ang once say: "Now people say Wen Emperor change law, not ancient custom.
translations.idiomatic: Ang once said: "Now people say Emperor Wen changed the law and did not follow ancient customs.

sentences.zh: 然袁盎亦以數直諫，不得久居中，調為隴西都尉。

translations.literal: But I see Emperor change ancient, establish new, not change law not ancient custom."
translations.idiomatic: But I see that the Emperor changed the ancient ways and established new ones—not changing the law is not following ancient customs."

sentences.zh: 仁愛士卒，士卒皆爭為死。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen favor Ang, Ang also straight speak.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen favored Ang, and Ang also spoke frankly.

sentences.zh: 遷為齊相。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen die, Jing Emperor ascend.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen died, Emperor Jing ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 徙為吳相，辭行，種謂盎曰：「吳王驕日久，國多姦。

translations.literal: Jing Emperor initially ascend, favor Ang.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Jing first ascended, he favored Ang.

sentences.zh: 今茍欲劾治，彼不上書告君，即利劍刺君矣。

translations.literal: Ang once ride horse with Emperor, Emperor say: "I alone with you, want hear straight words."
translations.idiomatic: Ang once rode with the emperor, and the emperor said: "I am alone with you and want to hear straightforward words."

sentences.zh: 南方卑溼，君能日飲，毋何，時說王曰毋反而已。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Emperor want hear straight words, Ang die not dare not say.
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "If Your Majesty wants to hear straightforward words, Ang will not dare not to speak even if it costs him his life.

sentences.zh: 如此幸得脫。」

translations.literal: Now Emperor establish prince, but prince mother not noble, this ancient rare.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty is establishing a crown prince, but the crown prince's mother is not noble—this is rare in ancient times.

sentences.zh: 盎用種之計，吳王厚遇盎。

translations.literal: Emperor establish prince, prince mother should noble, prince mother not noble, prince position not secure."
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty is establishing a crown prince; the crown prince's mother should be noble. If the crown prince's mother is not noble, the crown prince's position will not be secure."

sentences.zh: 盎告歸，道逢丞相申屠嘉，下車拜謁，丞相從車上謝袁盎。

translations.literal: Emperor say: "What can do?"
translations.idiomatic: The emperor asked: "What can be done?"

sentences.zh: 袁盎還，愧其吏，乃之丞相舍上謁，求見丞相。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Can not establish, establish then should kill mother, bury with prince."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "It can be not established; if established, then the mother should be killed and buried with the crown prince."

sentences.zh: 丞相良久而見之。

translations.literal: Emperor hear, not happy.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor heard this and was displeased.

sentences.zh: 盎因跪曰：「願請閒。」

translations.literal: Later Ang make mistake, Emperor want kill Ang.
translations.idiomatic: Later Ang made a mistake, and the emperor wanted to kill Ang.

sentences.zh: 丞相曰：「使君所言公事，之曹與長史掾議，吾且奏之；

translations.literal: Ang escape, Emperor anger not reduce.
translations.idiomatic: Ang fled, but the emperor's anger did not diminish.

sentences.zh: 即私邪，吾不受私語。」

translations.literal: Ang friend庚 say: "Ang straight speak, Emperor anger, you can make Ang straight speak apologize."
translations.idiomatic: Ang's friend Geng said: "Ang speaks frankly, and the emperor is angry with him. You can make Ang speak frankly to apologize."

sentences.zh: 袁盎即跪說曰：「君為丞相，自度孰與陳平、絳侯？」

translations.literal: 庚 go tell Ang: "Emperor anger you, you go apologize, Emperor anger reduce."
translations.idiomatic: Geng went and told Ang: "The emperor is angry with you; if you go and apologize, the emperor's anger will diminish."

sentences.zh: 丞相曰：「吾不如。」

translations.literal: Ang say: "Not I fault, why apologize?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "It is not my fault—why should I apologize?"

sentences.zh: 袁盎曰：「善，君即自謂不如。

translations.literal: 庚 say: "Emperor establish prince, you say should kill mother, bury with prince, this straight speak?"
translations.idiomatic: Geng said: "The emperor is establishing a crown prince, and you said the mother should be killed and buried with the crown prince—is this speaking frankly?"

sentences.zh: 夫陳平、絳侯輔翼高帝，定天下，為將相，而誅諸呂，存劉氏；

translations.literal: Ang say: "If not establish prince, this good; establish prince, should kill mother, bury with prince, this ancient law.
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "If the crown prince is not established, that would be good; if established, then the mother should be killed and buried with the crown prince—this is the ancient law.

sentences.zh: 君乃為材官蹶張，遷為隊率，積功至淮陽守，非有奇計攻城野戰之功。

translations.literal: I not wrong."
translations.idiomatic: I am not wrong."

sentences.zh: 且陛下從代來，每朝，郎官上書疏，未嘗不止輦受其言，言不可用置之，言可受採之，未嘗不稱善。

translations.literal: 庚 say: "Emperor establish prince, you not congratulate, instead speak kill mother, bury with prince, this not loyal minister behavior."
translations.idiomatic: Geng said: "The emperor is establishing a crown prince, and you did not congratulate him, but instead spoke of killing the mother and burying her with the crown prince—this is not the behavior of a loyal minister."

sentences.zh: 何也？

translations.literal: Ang think, then go apologize.
translations.idiomatic: Ang reflected on this, then went to apologize.

sentences.zh: 則欲以致天下賢士大夫。

translations.literal: Ang once advise Emperor Jing, say: "I see Emperor establish crown prince, this great matter.
translations.idiomatic: Ang once advised Emperor Jing, saying: "I see that Your Majesty is establishing a crown prince—this is a great matter.

sentences.zh: 上日聞所不聞，明所不知，日益聖智；

translations.literal: Crown prince establish, mother should noble, this ancient law.
translations.idiomatic: Once the crown prince is established, his mother should be noble—this is the ancient law.

sentences.zh: 君今自閉鉗天下之口而日益愚。

translations.literal: Now crown prince mother Wang夫人, Wang夫人 mother李, 李 mother淳于, all Lü family descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Now the crown prince's mother is Lady Wang, Lady Wang's mother is Li, Li's mother is Chunyu—they are all descendants of the Lü family.

sentences.zh: 夫以聖主責愚相，君受禍不久矣。」

translations.literal: I fear people say Emperor favor Lü family, establish Lü descendant as prince."
translations.idiomatic: I fear people will say that Your Majesty favors the Lü family and establishes a descendant of the Lü family as crown prince."

sentences.zh: 丞相乃再拜曰：「嘉鄙野人，乃不知，將軍幸教。」

translations.literal: Emperor Jing anger, say: "What man dare say this!"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Jing became angry and said: "Who dares to say such a thing!"

sentences.zh: 引入與坐，為上客。

translations.literal: Ang say: "I dare say."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "I dare to say it."

sentences.zh: 盎素不好鼂錯，鼂錯所居坐，盎去；

translations.literal: Emperor Jing say: "This Lü descendant matter, you stop."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Jing said: "This matter of Lü family descendants—you stop speaking of it."

sentences.zh: 盎坐，錯亦去：兩人未嘗同堂語。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Stop can, but I fear later people say."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "I can stop speaking, but I fear people will say it later."

sentences.zh: 及孝文帝崩，孝景帝即位，鼂錯為御史大夫，使吏案袁盎受吳王財物，抵罪，詔赦以為庶人。

translations.literal: Emperor Jing not adopt.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Jing did not adopt his advice.

sentences.zh: 吳楚反，聞，鼂錯謂丞史曰：「夫袁盎多受吳王金錢，專為蔽匿，言不反。

translations.literal: Yuan Ang complete speak Wu so rebel condition, because Cuo reason, alone urgent behead Cuo to thank Wu, Wu troops then can stop.
translations.idiomatic: When Wu and Chu rebelled and news of it was heard, Chao Cuo told the Chancellor's secretary: "Yuan Ang received much gold and money from the Wu King, and specialized in concealing and hiding it, saying they would not rebel.

sentences.zh: 今果反，欲請治盎宜知計謀。」

translations.literal: Chao Cuo hear, night see丞相府吏, say: "廿臣盡節死，陛下必負臣；臣盡節死，陛下無負臣。"
translations.idiomatic: Now they have indeed rebelled, so I want to request that Ang be investigated for knowing of their plans and schemes."

sentences.zh: 丞史曰：「事未發，治之有絕。

translations.literal: Ang see Emperor, Emperor say: "What do?"
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor's secretary said: "If the matter has not yet broken out, investigating it would cut off relations.

sentences.zh: 今兵西鄉，治之何益！

translations.literal: Ang say: "Wish consent behead Chao Cuo, send head to Wu, Wu then stop."
translations.idiomatic: Now the troops are facing west, what benefit would investigating bring!

sentences.zh: 且袁盎不宜有謀。」

translations.literal: Emperor say: "If not I, Chao Cuo die long ago, I not bear heart."
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Yuan Ang is not the type to have schemes."

sentences.zh: 鼂錯猶與未決。

translations.literal: Ang say: "Not kill Cuo, cannot stop rebellion."
translations.idiomatic: Chao Cuo was still undecided.

sentences.zh: 人有告袁盎者，袁盎恐，夜見竇嬰，為言吳所以反者，願至上前口對狀。

translations.literal: Emperor then kill Chao Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: Someone informed Yuan Ang, who became afraid and went to see Dou Ying at night, telling him the reasons Wu had rebelled, and wishing to go before the Emperor to personally explain the situation.

sentences.zh: 竇嬰入言上，上乃召袁盎入見。

translations.literal: Cuo behead, send head to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Dou Ying went in and spoke to the Emperor, who then summoned Yuan Ang for an audience.

sentences.zh: 鼂錯在前，及盎請辟人賜閒，錯去，固恨甚。

translations.literal: Wu see Cuo head, say: "丞相死，吾亦死。"
translations.idiomatic: Chao Cuo was present, but when Ang requested that others be dismissed and some private time granted, Cuo left, harboring deep resentment.

sentences.zh: 袁盎具言吳所以反狀，以錯故，獨急斬錯以謝吳，吳兵乃可罷。

translations.literal: Then rate troops stop.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Ang fully explained the situation of Wu's rebellion, and because of Cuo's actions, urged that Cuo alone be urgently beheaded to apologize to Wu, so that Wu's troops could then be stopped.

sentences.zh: 其語具在吳事中。

translations.literal: Ang persuade stop Wu rebellion, establish merit.
translations.idiomatic: Chao Cuo heard of this, and at night went to see the Chancellor's office clerk, saying: "If I exhaust my loyalty and die, Your Majesty will certainly betray me; if I exhaust my loyalty and die, Your Majesty will not betray me."

sentences.zh: 使袁盎為太常，竇嬰為大將軍。

translations.literal: After, Ang sick.
translations.idiomatic: Ang saw the Emperor, who asked: "What should be done?"

sentences.zh: 兩人素相與善。

translations.literal: Lü Sheng say: "I see you have worry color."
translations.idiomatic: Ang replied: "I wish Your Majesty would consent to behead Chao Cuo and send his head to Wu, and Wu will then stop."

sentences.zh: 逮吳反。

translations.literal: Ang say: "吳楚時，楚王使人之邯鄲，見齊使者竇先生，說之曰：『吳王舉兵西鄉，欲屠滅漢國。
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor said: "If not for me, Chao Cuo would have died long ago—I cannot bear to do this."

sentences.zh: 諸陵長者長安中賢大夫爭附兩人，車隨者日數百乘。

translations.literal: 臣願以身為漢相，項羽已滅，楚王尚存，臣願與楚王為兄弟，共伐吳。』
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "If Cuo is not killed, the rebellion cannot be stopped."

sentences.zh: 及鼂錯已誅，袁盎以太常使吳。

translations.literal: 竇先生以告臣，臣告上，上使梁孝王擊之，滅楚。
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor then had Chao Cuo killed.

sentences.zh: 吳王欲使將，不肯。

translations.literal: 今楚王已死，竇先生為丞相，臣為御史大夫。
translations.idiomatic: Cuo was beheaded and his head sent to Wu.

sentences.zh: 欲殺之，使一都尉以五百人圍守盎軍中。

translations.literal: 竇先生相梁孝王，梁孝王與竇先生有舊故，竇先生有足矣。
translations.idiomatic: When Wu saw Cuo's head, he said: "The Chancellor is dead, so I will die too."

sentences.zh: 袁盎自其為吳相時，（嘗）有從史嘗盜愛盎侍兒，盎知之，弗泄，遇之如故。

translations.literal: 臣無梁孝王故，竇先生必欲殺臣以自解。"
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered his troops to stop.

sentences.zh: 人有告從史，言「君知爾與侍者通」，乃亡歸。

translations.literal: Lü Sheng say: "You can go see丞相."
translations.idiomatic: Ang persuaded the court to stop the Wu rebellion and established merit.

sentences.zh: 袁盎驅自追之，遂以侍者賜之，復為從史。

translations.literal: Ang say: "I go, 丞相必留臣，臣欲死。"
translations.idiomatic: Later, Ang became ill.

sentences.zh: 及袁盎使吳見守，從史適為守盎校尉司馬，乃悉以其裝齎置二石醇醪，會天寒，士卒饑渴，飲酒醉，西南陬卒皆臥，司馬夜引袁盎起，曰：「君可以去矣，吳王期旦日斬君。」

translations.literal: Lü Sheng say: "You can go see梁孝王."
translations.idiomatic: Lü Sheng said: "I see you have a worried expression."

sentences.zh: 盎弗信，曰：「公何為者？」

translations.literal: Ang say: "梁孝王有丞相故，必不留臣。"
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "During the Wu and Chu rebellion, the Chu King sent someone to Handan, where he saw the Qi envoy Dou Xian, and said to him: 'The Wu King has raised troops and is facing west, wanting to slaughter and destroy the Han state.

sentences.zh: 司馬曰：「臣故為從史盜君侍兒者。」

translations.literal: Ang then go see梁孝王.
translations.idiomatic: I wish to offer myself as Chancellor for Han, for Xiang Yu has already been destroyed, but the Chu King still survives, so I wish to become brothers with the Chu King and together attack Wu.'

sentences.zh: 盎乃驚謝曰；

translations.literal: 梁孝王 detain Ang, not send.
translations.idiomatic: Dou Xian told this to me, and I told the Emperor, who sent Liang Xiaowang to attack and destroy Chu.

sentences.zh: 「公幸有親，吾不足以累公。」

translations.literal: 丞相闻, say: "袁盎病, 欲归长安, 我留之, 必有奸."
translations.idiomatic: Now the Chu King is dead, Dou Xian is Chancellor, and I am Imperial Secretary.

sentences.zh: 司馬曰：「君弟去，臣亦且亡，辟吾親，君何患！」

translations.literal: 丞相 then go see Emperor, say: "袁盎病, 欲归长安, 我留之, 必有奸."
translations.idiomatic: Dou Xian is Chancellor for Liang Xiaowang, and Liang Xiaowang has old ties with Dou Xian, so Dou Xian is secure.

sentences.zh: 乃以刀決張，道從醉卒（直）隧［直］出。

translations.literal: Emperor say: "袁盎欲归长安, 何为留之?"
translations.idiomatic: I have no old ties with Liang Xiaowang, so Dou Xian will certainly want to kill me to free himself."

sentences.zh: 司馬與分背，袁盎解節毛懷之，杖，步行七八里，明，見梁騎，騎馳去，遂歸報。

translations.literal: 丞相 say: "袁盎病, 欲归长安, 梁孝王留之, 此必有奸."
translations.idiomatic: Lü Sheng said: "You can go see the Chancellor."

sentences.zh: 吳楚已破，上更以元王子平陸侯禮為楚王，袁盎為楚相。

translations.literal: Emperor say: "遣袁盎归长安."
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "If I go, the Chancellor will certainly detain me, and I want to die."

sentences.zh: 嘗上書有所言，不用。

translations.literal: 丞相 then go see梁孝王, say: "袁盎病, 欲归长安, 梁孝王留之, 此必有奸."
translations.idiomatic: Lü Sheng said: "You can go see Liang Xiaowang."

sentences.zh: 袁盎病免居家，與閭里浮沈，相隨行，鬬雞走狗。

translations.literal: 梁孝王 say: "袁盎病, 欲归长安, 何为留之?"
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "Liang Xiaowang has ties with the Chancellor, so he will certainly not detain me."

sentences.zh: 雒陽劇孟嘗過袁盎，盎善待之。

translations.literal: 梁孝王 then release Ang.
translations.idiomatic: Ang then went to see Liang Xiaowang.

sentences.zh: 安陵富人有謂盎曰：「吾聞劇孟博徒，將軍何自通之？」

translations.literal: Ang return to长安, see Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Liang Xiaowang detained Ang and did not send him away.

sentences.zh: 盎曰：「劇孟雖博徒，然母死，客送葬車千餘乘，此亦有過人者。

translations.literal: Ang say: "臣欲归长安, 梁孝王留臣, 臣欲死."
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor heard of this and said: "Yuan Ang is ill and wants to return to Chang'an. If I detain him, there must be some plot."

sentences.zh: 且緩急人所有。

translations.literal: Emperor say: "梁孝王留袁盎, 何也?"
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor then went to see the Emperor and said: "Yuan Ang is ill and wants to return to Chang'an. If I detain him, there must be some plot."

sentences.zh: 夫一旦有急叩門，不以親為解，不以存亡為辭，天下所望者，獨季心、劇孟耳。

translations.literal: Ang say: "臣闻梁孝王与竇婴有旧故, 竇婴丞相, 梁孝王必欲留臣以自解."
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor said: "If Yuan Ang wants to return to Chang'an, why detain him?"

sentences.zh: 今公常從數騎，一旦有緩急，寧足恃乎！」

translations.literal: Emperor know Dou Ying not have intention, then pardon Ang.
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor said: "Yuan Ang is ill and wants to return to Chang'an, but Liang Xiaowang is detaining him—this must be some plot."

sentences.zh: 罵富人，弗與通。

translations.literal: Ang later die.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor said: "Send Yuan Ang back to Chang'an."

sentences.zh: 諸公聞之，皆多袁盎。

translations.literal: Ang son receive command, but not name.
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor then went to see Liang Xiaowang and said: "Yuan Ang is ill and wants to return to Chang'an, but Liang Xiaowang is detaining him—this must be some plot."

sentences.zh: 袁盎雖家居，景帝時時使人問籌策。

translations.literal: 太史公曰：袁盎雖不好學，亦善於勝己也。
translations.idiomatic: Liang Xiaowang said: "If Yuan Ang is ill and wants to return to Chang'an, why detain him?"

sentences.zh: 梁王欲求為嗣，袁盎進說，其後語塞。

translations.literal: 自泰伯以來，功臣世祿，絕滅無餘，袁盎獨有後焉。
translations.idiomatic: Liang Xiaowang then released Ang.

sentences.zh: 梁王以此怨盎，曾使人刺盎。

translations.literal: 可謂富貴不忘君者也。
translations.idiomatic: Ang returned to Chang'an and saw the Emperor.

sentences.zh: 刺者至關中，問袁盎，諸君譽之皆不容口。

translations.literal: 鼂錯雖有智辨，至於事親孝，與兄弟信，與朋友交，以誠感人，觸犯貴戚，欲以智勝人，亡之術也。
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "I wanted to return to Chang'an, but Liang Xiaowang detained me, and I wanted to die."

sentences.zh: 乃見袁盎曰：「臣受梁王金來刺君，君長者，不忍刺君。

translations.literal: 其亡可也。
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor said: "Why did Liang Xiaowang detain Yuan Ang?"

sentences.zh: 然後刺君者十餘曹，備之！」

translations.literal: 自古至今，國有亂臣，家有敗子，殺身亡國，非獨一人之罪也。
translations.idiomatic: Ang said: "I heard that Liang Xiaowang has old ties with Dou Ying, and since Dou Ying is Chancellor, Liang Xiaowang certainly wanted to detain me to clear himself."

sentences.zh: 袁盎心不樂，家又多怪，乃之棓生所問占。

translations.literal: 《詩》曰：「雨雪霏霏，見晛曰消。」
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor knew Dou Ying had no such intention, and then pardoned Ang.

sentences.zh: 還，梁刺客後曹輩果遮刺殺盎安陵郭門外。

translations.literal: 《易》曰：「知幾其神乎！」
translations.idiomatic: Ang later died.

sentences.zh: 鼂錯者，潁川人也。

translations.literal: 《詩》曰：「戰戰兢兢，如臨深淵，如履薄冰。」
translations.idiomatic: Ang's son received an official position, but was not famous.

sentences.zh: 學申商刑名於軹張恢先所，與雒陽宋孟及劉禮同師。

translations.literal: 善惡之端，始於微而顯於著，行之者不知也。
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Although Yuan Ang was not fond of study, he was also good at defeating himself.

sentences.zh: 以文學為太常掌故。

translations.literal: With literature become Grand Master of Ceremonies assistant.
translations.idiomatic: With his literary abilities, he became the assistant to the Grand Master of Ceremonies.

sentences.zh: 錯為人陗直刻深。

translations.literal: Cuo person narrow straight severe deep.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo was a person who was narrow-minded, straightforward, and severely critical.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝時，天下無治尚書者，獨聞濟南伏生故秦博士，治尚書，年九十餘，老不可徵，乃詔太常使人往受之。

translations.literal: Filial Wen Emperor time, world no treat Shangshu person, alone hear Jinan Fu Sheng former Qin scholar, treat Shangshu, age ninety more, old cannot summon, then decree Grand Master of Ceremonies send person go receive it.
translations.idiomatic: During Emperor Wen's time, there was no one in the world who studied the Shangshu, but it was heard that Fu Sheng of Jinan, a former Qin scholar who studied the Shangshu, was over ninety years old and too old to be summoned, so a decree was issued to the Grand Master of Ceremonies to send someone to receive instruction from him.

sentences.zh: 太常遣錯受尚書伏生所。

translations.literal: Grand Master of Ceremonies send Cuo receive Shangshu Fu Sheng place.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Master of Ceremonies sent Cuo to receive the Shangshu from Fu Sheng.

sentences.zh: 還，因上便宜事，以書稱說。

translations.literal: Return, because present beneficial matters, with writing title explain.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, he presented beneficial matters, explaining them with writings and titles.

sentences.zh: 詔以為太子舍人、門大夫、家令。

translations.literal: Decree make crown prince attendant, gate official, household administrator. With his eloquence gain crown prince favor, crown prince household call "wisdom pouch".
translations.idiomatic: He was decreed to be the crown prince's attendant, gate official, and household administrator. With his eloquence he gained the crown prince's favor, and the crown prince's household called him "the wisdom pouch".

sentences.zh: 以其辯得幸太子，太子家號曰「智囊」。

translations.literal: Frequently submit writing speak feudal lords matters and laws rewards punishments, secretly believe emperor not yet have what approve, secretly speak all items connect.
translations.idiomatic: He frequently submitted writings discussing the affairs of the feudal lords and laws, rewards, and punishments, secretly believing that the emperor had not yet decided on anything, secretly speaking of all the general principles.

sentences.zh: 數上書孝文時，言削諸侯事，及法令可更定者。

translations.literal: Plan strategy tent curtain, decisively take match ruler, become name high.
translations.idiomatic: He planned strategies in the tent, decisively making decisions that pleased the ruler, gaining a high reputation.

sentences.zh: 書數十上，孝文不聽，然奇其材，遷為中大夫。

translations.literal: With his able call central grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Because of his abilities, he was made a central grand master.

sentences.zh: 當是時，太子善錯計策，袁盎諸大功臣多不好錯。

translations.literal: Cuo again submit writing speak guard border prepare passes, encourage agriculture emphasize fundamentals, current age urgent matters two things.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo again submitted a writing discussing guarding the borders and preparing the passes, encouraging agriculture and emphasizing the fundamentals—these two urgent matters of the current age.

sentences.zh: 景帝即位，以錯為內史。

translations.literal: Writing present, secretly believe border matters always suffer it.
translations.idiomatic: When the writing was presented, he secretly believed that border matters were always troublesome.

sentences.zh: 錯常數請閒言事，輒聽，寵幸傾九卿，法令多所更定。

translations.literal: After decree make oversee sacrificial officials, repeatedly self request guard northern border passes, move people populate them.
translations.idiomatic: Later, when he was ordered to oversee the sacrificial officials, he repeatedly requested to guard the northern border passes and move people to populate them.

sentences.zh: 丞相申屠嘉心弗便，力未有以傷。

translations.literal: Emperor admire his words, but not yet use them.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor admired his words but did not yet employ them.

sentences.zh: 內史府居太上廟壖中，門東出，不便，錯乃穿兩門南出，鑿廟壖垣。

translations.literal: After fifteen years, Jing Emperor ascend throne, make interior minister.
translations.idiomatic: Fifteen years later, when Emperor Jing ascended the throne, he made Cuo the interior minister.

sentences.zh: 丞相嘉聞，大怒，欲因此過為奏請誅錯。

translations.literal: Cuo frequently request private speak matters, secretly believe emperor first ascend, should change previous kings policy, focus agriculture sericulture, reduce extravagance, belittle merchants, recruit four directions scholars, honor Confucian scholars, establish great university, repair suburban sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo frequently requested private audiences to discuss matters, secretly believing that when the emperor first ascended, he should change the policies of previous kings, focus on farming and sericulture, reduce extravagance, belittle merchants, recruit scholars from the four directions, honor Confucian scholars, establish the great university, and repair the suburban sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 錯聞之，即夜請閒，具為上言之。

translations.literal: Want minister son loyalty, father son order, ruler minister righteousness, then world orderly.
translations.idiomatic: He wanted loyalty from ministers and sons, proper order between fathers and sons, and righteousness between rulers and ministers, and then the world would be orderly.

sentences.zh: 丞相奏事，因言錯擅鑿廟垣為門，請下廷尉誅。

translations.literal: Secretly believe king way beginning, should be here.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly believed that this should be the beginning of the kingly way.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「此非廟垣，乃壖中垣，不致於法。」

translations.literal: Secretly speak all thirty chapters.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly spoke of this in thirty chapters in total.

sentences.zh: 丞相謝。

translations.literal: Cuo serve crown prince household administrator, gain crown prince favor, frequently leisurely speak with crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo served as the crown prince's household administrator and gained the crown prince's favor, frequently speaking leisurely with the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 罷朝，怒謂長史曰：「吾當先斬以聞，乃先請，為兒所賣，固誤。」

translations.literal: Secretly believe crown prince should know techniques numbers, not let joy anger appearance show externally, secretly for crown prince tutors not dismiss, observe left right, not let bad crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly believed that the crown prince should understand techniques and numbers, not letting joy, anger, or facial expressions show externally, and that the crown prince's tutors should not be dismissed, observing the attendants around him, not letting them corrupt the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 丞相遂發病死。

translations.literal: Crown prince once with Liang Wang same carriage enter court, not descend Marshal Gate, then Chao Cuo as crown prince household administrator, hold imperial seal writing to Marshal Gate, hurry out give crown prince Liang Wang each one horse, apologize say: "King crown prince both court, Marshal Gate then close."
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince once entered the court in the same carriage as Liang Wang without getting down at the Marshal's Gate. Chao Cuo, as the crown prince's household administrator, held the imperial seal and writing and went to the Marshal's Gate, hurried out and gave each of the crown prince and Liang Wang a horse, apologizing: "Both the king and crown prince are going to court, but the Marshal's Gate is closed."

sentences.zh: 錯以此愈貴。

translations.literal: Liang Wang with this resent Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: Liang Wang resented Cuo because of this.

sentences.zh: 遷為御史大夫，請諸侯之罪過，削其地，收其枝郡。

translations.literal: Cuo what change command make law, all fit convenience, officials people praise it.
translations.idiomatic: All the laws that Cuo changed were convenient and appropriate, and officials and people praised him.

sentences.zh: 奏上，上令公卿列侯宗室集議，莫敢難，獨竇嬰爭之，由此與錯有卻。

translations.literal: Cuo frequently request private speak matters, secretly believe people poor, then Zhao She, Qin use Shang Yang method, change emperor king system, remove their sharp, change their strong.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo frequently requested private audiences to discuss matters, secretly believing that when the people are poor, then Zhao She and Qin used Shang Yang's methods, changing the system of the emperors and kings, removing their sharpness, and changing their strength.

sentences.zh: 錯所更令三十章，諸侯皆諠譁疾鼂錯。

translations.literal: Secretly believe people rich then peaceful village value home, people poor then light leave their village, bandit thief have what accumulate.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly believed that when the people are rich they stay in their villages and value their homes, when the people are poor they lightly leave their villages, and bandits and thieves have places to gather.

sentences.zh: 錯父聞之，從潁川來，謂錯曰：「上初即位，公為政用事，侵削諸侯，別疏人骨肉，人口議多怨公者，何也？」

translations.literal: Emperor from his words, order people can sell field, free slaves concubines, make people consider convenient.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor followed his words, ordering that people could sell their fields and free their slaves and concubines, and the people found it convenient.

sentences.zh: 鼂錯曰：「固也。

translations.literal: Wu Chu seven states rebel, Cuo make imperial secretary, receive decree pardon exempt people move populate pass below, get thirty thousand people, move them pass below.
translations.idiomatic: When the seven states of Wu and Chu rebelled, Cuo served as imperial secretary, received the decree to pardon and exempt people to move and populate the border areas below the passes, and got thirty thousand people, moving them to the areas below the passes.

sentences.zh: 不如此，天子不尊，宗廟不安。」

translations.literal: Cuo with imperial secretary from east come, reach Luoyang, hear Wu Chu rebel, troops about arrive, way meet imperial secretary Zhao Yu, Yu with military matters advise Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo, as imperial secretary, came from the east, and when he reached Luoyang, he heard that Wu and Chu had rebelled and their troops were about to arrive. On the way he met the imperial secretary Zhao Yu, who advised Cuo about military matters.

sentences.zh: 錯父曰：「劉氏安矣，而鼂氏危矣，吾去公歸矣！」

translations.literal: Cuo very fear, night enter army, tell general say: "Minister hear Wu Chu troops sharp very, difficult with contend sharp, minister wish with humble words for negotiate peace, follow guide them, they one move, still resist thousand miles outside."
translations.idiomatic: Cuo was very afraid, and at night entered the army camp, telling the general: "I have heard that the troops of Wu and Chu are very sharp, difficult to contend with directly. I wish to use humble words to negotiate peace, leading them along obediently. If they make one move, we can resist them a thousand miles away."

sentences.zh: 遂飲藥死，曰：「吾不忍見禍及吾身。」

translations.literal: Cuo not reach act, Han troops great defeat Wu Chu troops.
translations.idiomatic: Before Cuo could act, Han troops greatly defeated the Wu and Chu armies.

sentences.zh: 死十餘日，吳楚七國果反，以誅錯為名。

translations.literal: Cuo again speak guard prepare border passes, encourage agriculture emphasize fundamentals.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo again spoke of guarding and preparing the border passes, encouraging agriculture and emphasizing the fundamentals.

sentences.zh: 及竇嬰、袁盎進說，上令鼂錯衣朝衣斬東市。

translations.literal: Current age urgent matters two things, again speak: "Your Majesty issue anger, raise troops punish them, finally defeat them, this heaven destroy them.
translations.idiomatic: These two urgent matters of the current age, and again said: "Your Majesty became indignant and raised troops to punish them, finally defeating them—this was heaven destroying them.

sentences.zh: 鼂錯已死，謁者仆射鄧公為校尉，擊吳楚軍為將。

translations.literal: However Your Majesty should self worry, world scholars resent accumulate on Your Majesty person, Your Majesty not self worry, minister fear change born from feudal lords after."
translations.idiomatic: However, Your Majesty should worry about yourself. The resentful feelings of the world's scholars have accumulated on Your Majesty's person. If Your Majesty does not worry about yourself, I fear change will arise after the feudal lords."

sentences.zh: 還，上書言軍事，謁見上。

translations.literal: Cuo again speak: "Military matters upper urgent, appropriate move relocate people border, their garrison troops assign, very repair guard border lands."
translations.idiomatic: Cuo again spoke: "Military matters are urgent above all, it is appropriate to move and relocate people to the borders, and their garrison troops should repair and guard the border areas."

sentences.zh: 上問曰：「道軍所來，聞鼂錯死，吳楚罷不？」

translations.literal: Cuo frequently submit writing, speak appropriate reduce feudal lords matters, and laws can change decide, writing all thirty chapters.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo frequently submitted writings discussing the matter of reducing the feudal lords, and laws that could be revised, with writings totaling thirty chapters.

sentences.zh: 鄧公曰：「吳王為反數十年矣，發怒削地，以誅錯為名，其意非在錯也。

translations.literal: Your Majesty although not completely listen use, but consider his talent extraordinary.
translations.idiomatic: Although Your Majesty did not fully listen and employ them, he considered his talents extraordinary.

sentences.zh: 且臣恐天下之士噤口，不敢復言也！」

translations.literal: Cuo what change command thirty chapters, feudal lords clamor.
translations.idiomatic: The thirty chapters of laws that Cuo changed caused the feudal lords to clamor in protest.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「何哉？」

translations.literal: Cuo father hear then exhort say: "Emperor first ascend throne, you handle affairs use power, encroach reduce feudal lords, alienate person relatives, mouth speak many resent, you what do?"
translations.idiomatic: Cuo's father heard of this and exhorted him: "Your Majesty has just ascended the throne, you are handling political affairs, encroaching on and reducing the feudal lords, alienating the ruler's relatives, and your words create much resentment—what are you doing?"

sentences.zh: 鄧公曰：「夫鼂錯患諸侯彊大不可制，故請削地以尊京師，萬世之利也。

translations.literal: Cuo apologize say: "Indeed, not like this, Son of Heaven not honor, ancestral temples not secure."
translations.idiomatic: Cuo apologized: "Indeed, if not done this way, the Son of Heaven will not be honored, and the ancestral temples will not be secure."

sentences.zh: 計畫始行，卒受大戮，內杜忠臣之口，外為諸侯報仇，臣竊為陛下不取也。」

translations.literal: Father say: "Liu clan secure, Chao clan danger, I leave you return!"
translations.idiomatic: His father said: "The Liu clan will be secure, but the Chao clan will be in danger—I am leaving you and returning home!"

sentences.zh: 於是景帝默然良久，曰：「公言善，吾亦恨之。」

translations.literal: Then drink poison die, say: "I not bear see disaster reach my body."
translations.idiomatic: He then drank poison and died, saying: "I cannot bear to see disaster come upon myself."

sentences.zh: 乃拜鄧公為城陽中尉。

translations.literal: Die ten more days, Wu Chu seven states indeed rebel, with execute Cuo as name.
translations.idiomatic: Ten days after his death, the seven states of Wu and Chu indeed rebelled, using the execution of Cuo as their pretext.

sentences.zh: 鄧公，成固人也，多奇計。

translations.literal: Reach Dou Ying, Yuan Ang advance speak, emperor order Chao Cuo wear court robes behead eastern market.
translations.idiomatic: When Dou Ying and Yuan Ang advanced their arguments, the emperor ordered Chao Cuo to put on court robes and be beheaded in the eastern market.

sentences.zh: 建元中，上招賢良，公卿言鄧公，時鄧公免，起家為九卿。

translations.literal: Cuo wear court robes behead eastern market, father Jiang Hou meritorious official, various lords not dare for speak, Chao Cuo with wisdom eloquence destroy state, exterminate Chao clan.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo was beheaded in court robes in the eastern market. His father Jiang Hou was a meritorious official, but the various lords dared not speak for him. Chao Cuo brought destruction to the state with his wisdom and eloquence, and the Chao clan was exterminated.

sentences.zh: 一年，復謝病免歸。

translations.literal: From Qin use Shang Yang, burn poems documents while clarify laws commands, change emperor king system, later generations with Shang Yang, Chao Cuo as world misfortune.
translations.idiomatic: Since Qin employed Shang Yang, burned the poems and documents while clarifying laws and commands, changing the system of emperors and kings, later generations considered Shang Yang and Chao Cuo to be the world's misfortunes.

sentences.zh: 其子章以修黃老言顯於諸公閒。

translations.literal: From ancient to now, state have change chaos ministers, family have defeat sons, kill body destroy state, not alone one person fault.
translations.idiomatic: From ancient times to now, when a state has rebellious ministers, when a family has degenerate sons, when someone brings death upon himself and destroys the state—it is not the fault of one person alone.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：袁盎雖不好學，亦善傅會，仁心為質，引義慨。

translations.literal: Grand Historian say: Zhang Cang literature laws calendars, become Han famous chancellor, Jiang Hou become general, though have field battle attack city merit, Zhang Cang, Jiang Hou also have assist support merit, but Wen Emperor practice frugality, Lü Empress Dowager with extravagance, Filial Wen though worthy, because mother reason, not dare completely implement his way.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Zhang Cang was skilled in literature, calendars, and laws, becoming a famous Han chancellor, while Jiang Hou was a general, though they had merits in field battles and attacking cities, Zhang Cang and Jiang Hou also had merits in assisting and supporting. However, Emperor Wen practiced frugality, while Empress Lü was extravagant. Although Emperor Wen was worthy, because of his mother, he did not dare fully implement his way.

sentences.zh: 遭孝文初立，資適逢世。

translations.literal: Reach Filial Jing, not again serve Empress Dowager, Jing Emperor with frugality govern country, world prosperous rich, common people peaceful happy, though cannot reach Wen Emperor flourishing, but Wen Jing between, world almost reach punishments set aside.
translations.idiomatic: Until Emperor Jing, he no longer served the Empress Dowager. Emperor Jing governed the country with frugality, the world became prosperous, and the common people lived in peace. Although he could not reach Emperor Wen's flourishing, during the Wen and Jing reigns, the world almost reached the point where punishments were set aside.

sentences.zh: 時以變易，及吳楚一說，說雖行哉，然復不遂。

translations.literal: This Zhang Cang, Jiang Hou merit.
translations.idiomatic: This was the merit of Zhang Cang and Jiang Hou.

sentences.zh: 好聲矜賢，竟以名敗。

translations.literal: Chao Cuo make imperial secretary, uphold law maintain correct, bend not please others, though not good end, but also have assist support merit.
translations.idiomatic: Chao Cuo served as imperial secretary, upholding the law and maintaining correctness, not bending to please others. Although he did not have a good end, he also had merits in assisting and supporting.

sentences.zh: 鼂錯為家令時，數言事不用；
後擅權，多所變更。
諸侯發難，不急匡救，欲報私讎，反以亡軀。
語曰「變古亂常，不死則亡」，豈錯等謂邪！
